responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Command Injection in tools/update_po.pl
    analysis: |
      The script `tools/update_po.pl` takes Transifex credentials on the command line and uses them to build a `wget` command.
      If an attacker can control the Transifex password, they likely control other parts of the command as well, such as the downloaded filename.
      That filename is used in a subshell started with Perl's backticks operator, without any sanitization.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tools/update_po.pl
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Command Injection in tools/update_mo.pl
    analysis: |
      The script `tools/update_mo.pl` iterates over all files in the `locales/` directory.
      If an attacker can plant a file with a crafted name in that directory, they control part of the command passed to `msgfmt` through Perl's backticks.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tools/update_mo.pl
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Command Injection in tools/update_po.pl
leads.analysis:
The script tools/update_po.pl takes Transifex credentials on the command line and uses them to build a wget command.
If an attacker can control the Transifex password, they likely control other parts of the command as well, such as the downloaded filename.
That filename is used in a subshell started with Perl's backticks operator, without any sanitization.

leads.headline: Command Injection in tools/update_mo.pl
leads.analysis:
The script tools/update_mo.pl iterates over all files in the locales/ directory.
If an attacker can plant a file with a crafted name in that directory, they control part of the command passed to msgfmt through Perl's backticks.
